newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Verbund dips after first half earnings.
newsitem.headline: Verbund dips after first half earnings.

text.p: Shares in Austrian utility Verbund dipped 0.78 percent in Vienna after the company reported a big rise in first half net profit but a 20 percent decrease in its operating result.
At 1138 GMT shares in Oesterreichische Elektrizitaetswirtschafts AG (Verbund) were six schillings down at 758.5 schillings on brisk turnover.
"Net and pre-tax profit figures look good but there are still a couple of risk factors," said a Vienna trader, pointing to the firm's long-standing Swiss franc debt position.
Analysts noted that operating profit had been depressed by higher fuel expenses and electricity purchase costs.
"That should not come as a surprise given the cold winter and low water levels," said Gerhard Auer, an analyst at ICE Securities in London.
He rated Verbund shares, which touched a life-high of 833 schillings earlier this year, a hold. -- Janet McBride, Vienna Newsroom 43-1-531 12 254
